dialogues.text: Escobar points to the number "MU 7279" on the side of one the kitchen cabinets.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Isn't that your number?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is it? I forget. I don't call myself  that often.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just to be on the safe side, we had  Loach here give you a ring.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He indicates one of his assistants.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (a slight sneer) What happened to your nose, Gittes?  Somebody slam a bedroom window on  it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (right back, smiling) Nope, your wife got excited, crossed  her legs a little too quick. You  understand, pal.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Assistant starts to move for Gittes who is ready for  him. Escobar steps between the two.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to other Assistant) Loach. (Escobar pulls out a  drawer) How about these? Look familiar?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In the open drawer are the photos of Mulwray and the girl the park, boat, and at the El Macando on the veranda.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (no point in denying  it) Yeah, I took 'em. So what?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How did she... (meaning the corpse) ...happen to have them?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gittes takes a deep breath.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Either you tell me or I guess 'cause  I don't have the answer.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Escobar nods.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You really think I'm stupid, don't  you, Gittes?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't think about it one way or  the other. But if you want, give me  a day or two, and I'll get back to  you. Now I'd like to go home.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I want the rest of the pictures.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What pictures?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (meaning the corpse) This broad hired you, Gittes, not  Evelyn Mulwray.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah. Somebody wanted to shake down  Mulwray, she hired you, and that's  how you happen to know Mulwray was  murdered.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I heard it was an accident.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: C'mon, you think you're dealing with  a bunch of assholes? Mulwray had  salt water in his goddam lungs! Now  how did he get that... in a fresh  water reservoir?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gittes is surprised at this piece of information, but rem nonplussed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You were following him night and  day. You saw who killed him. You  even took pictures of it. It was  Evelyn Mulwray. She's been paying  you off like a slot machine ever  since her husband died.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (smiling) You accusing me of extortion?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Absolutely.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't think I need a day or two.  You're even dumber than you think I  think you are. Not only that, I'd  never extort a nickel out of my worst  enemy, that's where I draw the line,  Escobar.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, I once knew a whore who for  enough money would piss in a  customer's face, but she'd never  shit on his chest. That's where she  drew the line.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (smiling) Well, I hope she wasn't too much of  a disappointment to you, Lou.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Escobar manages a thin smile.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I want those photographs, Gittes.  We're talking about accessory after  the fact, conspiracy, and extortion.  Minimum.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why do you think Mulwray's body was  moved you dimwit? Evelyn Mulwray  knocked off her husband in the ocean  and thought it would look like more  of an accident if she hauled him up  to the Oak Pass Reservoir?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is a little telling.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (continuing) Mulwray was murdered and moved because  somebody didn't want his body found  in the ocean.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And why's that?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He found out somebody was dumping  water there. That's what they were  trying to cover up by moving him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This stops Escobar. He's dumbfounded by it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What are you talking about?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: C'mon I'll show you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Escobar hesitates.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (continuing) C'mon make a decision, Lou. You're  in charge.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The men around Escobar look to him. Escobar grudgingly no

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It yawns AT CAMERA, only a trickle of water dropping into the ocean. VIEW WIDENS TO INCLUDE Escobar, Gittes, and two Plain  clothesmen, standing and staring at the empty pipe as if  they expect it to talk.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (squinting in sunlight) It's too late.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Too late for what?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They only dump the water at night.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A THIRD ASSISTANT runs down the side of the cliff and Ove to Escobar.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Reach anybody?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yelburton, he's the new chief.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know who he is. Well?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He says В–-

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know what he says.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Gittes) Shut up. (to Assistant) Go on.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yelburton says they're irrigating in  the valley. There's always a little  runoff when they do that. And he  says is Gittes knows that, and has  been going around making irresponsible  accusations for the last week.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Escobar turns to Gittes. Stares at him for a long moment.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let's swear out a warrant for her  arrest. What are we waiting for?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (meaning Escobar) Because he just made lieutenant, and  he wants to hang onto his little  gold bar.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Escobar stares hatefully at Gittes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Have your client in my office in two  hours and remember. I don't have to  let you go. I've got you for  withholding evidence right now.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gittes in Mulwray's Buick whips into the driveway. He loo in the garage. Evelyn's car is gone. Only the Gardener's  truck is there. Gittes hurries along the pathway and up to the house. He  rings the doorbell. Scarcely waiting for an answer he tri it. It's locked. He reaches into his pocket pulls out his cigarette case,  takes a pick out of the side and starts to fool with the  lock. The Maid opens the door abruptly, stares in some surprise Gittes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where's Mrs. Mulwray?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No esta.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gittes looks past the Maid to the center of the living ro where luggage is packed and neatly piled. The Maid is actually in the process of throwing covers ov the furniture.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (indicating luggage) Is Mrs. Mulwray going someplace?... (no answer) on a trip?... vacation?...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No esta in casa.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gittes nods. He continues through the house and out back the veranda.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is unsettled. Sees the Gardener working by the pond. He  wanders a few yards in that direction.

dialogues.speaker: GARDENER
dialogues.text: Spots Gittes, half-bows, nods and smiles.

dialogues.speaker: GITTES
dialogues.text: In turn, nods, smiles.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bad for glass.

dialogues.speaker: GARDENER
dialogues.text: Breaks into a big grin. Nods again.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh yes, bad for glass.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He points to the newly mown lawn.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (continuing) Salt water velly bad for glass.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Can't quite believe what he's heard,

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Salt water?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Gardener nods vigorously. Points to the pond.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Velly velly bad.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gittes has moved to the pond. He kneels. Clinging to the  edge of it he can now see as he could have before if he'd looked closely, a starfish.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It has one leg missing. The fifth point on the star is ju beginning to grow back.

dialogues.speaker: GITTES
dialogues.text: Touches the water, tastes it. He licks his lips, then spo something glinting in the bottom of the pond.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's that... down there?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Gardener peers into the pond.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (continuing) ...there.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Gardener spots it. He rolls up his trousers, gets in pond, and reaches into the bottom, his chin actually touc the water. He misses the object, which seems to scoot away like an  animal. Then he grasps it. He lifts it out of the water a holds a pair of eye glasses, rimless, bent, his finger po through the frame where one lens is shattered. The Gardener seems surprised. Gittes looks at the glasses They are heavily bifocal and reflect the sun.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gittes holds the phone to his ear. On the telephone table lying on his handkerchief are the glasses. The Maid hovers around over Gittes' shoulder, uneasily  watching him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hello.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Have you got your checkbook handy,  Mr. Cross? I've got the girl.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You've got her? Where?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do you remember the figures we  discussed?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Of course I do. Where are you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: At your daughter's house. How soon  can you get here?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Two hours... tell me, will Evelyn be  there as well?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Either that or she'll be in jail.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What are you talking about?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just bring your checkbook.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gittes hangs up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gittes pulls up in Mulwray's Buick. He hurries to the fro door, pounds on it. The Chinese servant answers the door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You wait.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (short sentence in  Chinese) You wait.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gittes pushes past him. Evelyn, looking a little worn but glad to see him hurries to the door. She takes Gittes' ar

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How are you? I was calling you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She looks at him, searching his face.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They move into the living room. Gittes is looking around

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Did you get some sleep?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sure.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Did you have lunch? Kyo will fix you  something.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (abruptly) Where's the girl?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Upstairs. Why?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I want to see her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...she's having a bath now... why do  you want to see her?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gittes continues to look around. He sees clothes laid out for packing in a bedroom off the living room.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Going somewhere?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes, we've got a 4:30 train to catch.  Why?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gittes doesn't answer. He goes to the phone and dials.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: J. J. Gittes for Lieutenant Escobar

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What are you doing? What's wrong? I  told you we've got a 4:30.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (cutting her off) You're going to miss your train! (then, into phone) Lou, meet me at 1412 Adelaide. It's  above Santa Monica Canyon... yeah,  soon as you can.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What did you do that for?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (a moment, then) You know any good criminal lawyers?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (puzzled) No...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't worry. I can recommend a couple. They're expensive but you can afford  it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (evenly but with great  anger) What the hell is this all about?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gittes looks at her, then takes the handkerchief out of h breast pocket. Unfolds it on a coffee table, revealing th bifocal glasses, one lens still intact. Evelyn stares dum at them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I found these in your backyard... in  your fish pond. They belonged to  your husband, didn't they?... didn't  they?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know. I mean yes, probably.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes positively. That's where he was  drowned...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What are you saying?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There's no time for you to be shocked  by the truth, Mrs. Mulwray. The  coroner's report proves he was killed  in salt water. Just take my word for  it. Now I want to know how it happened  and why. I want to know before Escobar  gets here because I want to hang  onto my license.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know what you're talking  about. This is the most insane...  the craziest thing I ever...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gittes has been in a state of near frenzy himself. gets u shakes her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stop it!  I'll make it easy. You  were jealous, you fought, he fell,  hit his head. It was an accident,  but his girl is a witness. You've  had to pay her off. You don't have  the stomach to harm her, but you've  got the money to shut her up. Yes or  no?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who is she? And don't give me that  crap about it being your sister. You  don't have a sister.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Evelyn is trembling.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll tell you the truth...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gittes smiles.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's good. Now what's her name?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Katherine.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Katherine?... Katherine who?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She's my daughter.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gittes stares at her. He's been charged with anger and wh Evelyn says this it explodes. He hits her full in the fac Evelyn stares back at him. The blow has forced tears from her eyes, but she makes no move, not even to defend herse

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I said the truth!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She's my sister.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gittes slaps her again.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She's my daughter.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gittes slaps her again.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My sister.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He hits her again.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My daughter, my sister.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He belts her finally, knocking her into a cheap Chinese v which shatters and she collapses on the sofa, sobbing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I said I want the truth.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (almost screaming it) She's my sister and my daughter!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kyo comes running down the stairs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (continuing; in Chinese) For God's sake, Kyo, keep her  upstairs, go back!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kyo turns after staring at Gittes for a moment then goes  back upstairs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My father and I, understand, or is  it too tough for you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gittes doesn't answer.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...he had a breakdown... the dam  broke... my mother died... he became  a little boy... I was fifteen...  he'd ask me what to eat for breakfast,  what clothes to wear!... It  happened... then I ran away...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: To Mexico...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She nods.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hollis came and took... care of me...  after she was born... he said... he  took care of her... I couldn't see  her... I wanted to but I couldn't...   I just want to see her once in a  while... take care of her... that's  all...  but I don't want her to  know... I don't want her to know...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...so that's why you hate him...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Evelyn looks slowly up at Gittes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No... for turning his back on me  after it happened! He couldn't face  it... (weeping) I hate him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gittes suddenly feels the need to loosen his tie.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah... where are you taking her  now?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Back to Mexico.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You can't go by train. Escobar'll be  looking for you everywhere.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How about a plane?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's worse... Just get out of here.  Walk out, leave everything.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I have to go home and get my things.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll take care of it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where can we go?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...where does Kyo live?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: With us.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: On his day off. Get the exact address.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She stops suddenly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Those didn't belong to Hollis.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: For a moment Gittes doesn't know what she's talking about Then he follows her gaze to the glasses lying on his  handkerchief.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How do you know?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He didn't wear bifocals.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gittes picks up the glasses, stares at the lens, is  momentarily lost in them.

dialogues.speaker: EVELYN
dialogues.text: From the stairs. She has her arm around Katherine.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Say hello to Mr. Gittes, sweetheart.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (from the stairs) Hello.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rises a little shakily from the arm  of the sofa.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hello.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: With her arm around the girl, talking in Spanish, Evelyn  hurries her toward the bedroom. In a moment she re-emerge

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (calling down) He lives at 1712 Alameda... do you  know where that is?

dialogues.speaker: REACTION
dialogues.text: He nods slowly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sure. It's Chinatown.

dialogues.speaker: THRU WINDOW
dialogues.text: Of bungalow Gittes watches Evelyn, the girl and Kyo head Kyo's black dusty sedan. Gittes drops the curtain, heads swiftly to the phone. He  dials.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sophie... is Walsh there?... yeah,  listen, pal, Escobar's going to try  and book me in about five minutes...  relax, I'll tell you. Wait in the  office for two hours. If you don't  hear from me, you and Duffy meet me  at 1712 Alameda.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jesus, that's in Chinatown, ain't  it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The front BELL RINGS.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know where it is! Just do it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gittes hangs up and goes to the door. He opens it. No one there.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (not even bothering  to look around the  sides) Come on in, Lou. We're both too late.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Escobar and his minions appear from either side of the do

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Looks like she flew the coop.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Escobar nods.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't suppose you got any idea  Where she went?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Matter of fact I do.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Her maid's house. I think she knows  something's up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's the maid's address?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She lives in Pedro. I'll write it  down for you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, Gittes, you'll show us.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What for?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If she's not there, you're going  downtown, and you're staying there  til she shows up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (deliberately petulant) Gee, Lou, I'm doing the best I can.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (shoving him toward  the door) Tell us about it on the way to Pedro.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A steep hill overlooks part of the harbor. Escobar's unma car pulls up to a stop in front of a Spanish duplex perch on the steep hillside.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, let's go.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do me a favor, will you, Lou?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Escobar waits.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (continuing) Let me bring her down myself... she's  not armed or nothing... she won't be  any problem... I'd just like a minute  alone with her... It would mean  something... to...  her... and to  me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Escobar shakes his head. For a moment it looks like it me no.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You never learn, do you, Gittes?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (a little chagrined) I guess not.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Give you three minutes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gee, thanks, Lou.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gittes gets out of the car, glances around, goes up the  stairs. He looks back down at Escobar. Gittes rings the b He waits. It opens. It's a WOMAN who's not recognizable.  She's got the remnants of a black eye.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes?...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gittes looks past her to Curly, the fisherman from the fi scene. He's seated at the dinner table with his father, his moth and his children. Curly looks up in surprise.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (happily) Mr. Gittes! Come in, come in.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gittes enters and closes the door. Curly rises and comes  over to him, greets him happily.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gee, this is a surprise, Mr. Gittes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Call me Jake. How is everything?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just sitting down to supper, Jake.  Care to join us?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No thanks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How about a glass of wine? Honey,  this is...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (coolly) Yes, I know.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thanks just the same, Curly. I could  use a glass of water, though. Come  out with me to the kitchen for a  second.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (puzzled) Sure thing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Curly, where's your car?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In the garage.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where's that?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Off the alley.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Could you drive me somewhere?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sure, as soon as we eat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Right now, Curly. It can't wait.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll just tell my wife.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (pulling him out the  back door) Tell her later.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They head out the back door and down the steps toward the garage.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Curly pulls open the garage door. Gets in, starts the car backs it out. It's an old, late twenties Plymouth Sedan.  Gittes hops in. They take off. At the edge of the alley G looks back.

dialogues.speaker: CURLY'S CAR
dialogues.text: Escobar is getting out of his car, moving towards the dup Gittes slips down in the seat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just drive slow for a block or two,  will you, Curly?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's this all about?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tell you in a couple of blocks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How much do you owe me, Curly?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (embarrassed) Oh, gee, Mr. Gittes we're going out  tomorrow. I know you been real good  about it but my cousin Auggie's sick.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Forget it. How would you like to pay  me off by taking a couple of  passengers to Ensenada... you'd have  to leave tonight.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I might be able to squeeze an extra  seventy-five bucks out of it for  you. Maybe an even hundred.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Plus what I owe you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll throw that in too.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (smiling) Okay, you got yourself a boat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carry bags out to Curly's car. Curly opens the door for t Maid. She gets in. He turns to Gittes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tell Mrs. Mulwray to wait for half  an hour after you get there. Then if  I don't show, take her down to the  boat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (a little worried) You sure this is okay?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (mildly indignant) Curly, you know how long I been in  business.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Curly nods, reassured. He gets in and takes off.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: By the pond, cigarette smoke drifts INTO SHOT. A car pull up. In a moment Cross can be SEEN, looking TOWARD CAMERA.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There you are.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He walks toward Gittes who stands by the pond, smoking.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (continuing) Well, you don't look any the worse  for wear, Mr. Gittes, I must say...  where's the girl?...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I've got her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is she all right?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She's fine.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where is she?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: With her mother.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cross' tone alters here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...with her mother?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gittes pulls something out of his pocket and unfolds it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'd like you to look at something,  Mr. Cross.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (taking it) What is it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: An obituary column... can you read  in this light?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes... I think I can manage...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cross dips into his coat pocket and pulls out a pair of  rimless glasses.. He puts them on, reads.

dialogues.speaker: GITTES
dialogues.text: Stares at the bifocal lenses as Cross continues to look  through the obituary column. He looks up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What does this mean?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That you killed Hollis Mulwray.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gittes is holding the bifocals with the broken lens now.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Right here, in this pond. You drowned  him...  and you left these.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cross looks at the glasses.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...the coroner's report showed Mulwray  had salt water in his lungs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (finally) Hollie was always fond of tide-pools.  You know what he used to say about  them?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Haven't the faintest idea.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's where life begins... marshes,  sloughs, tide-pools... he was  fascinated by them...  you know when  we first came out here he figured  that if you dumped water onto desert  sand it would percolate down into  the bedrock and stay there, instead  of evaporating the way it does in  most reservoirs. You'd lose only  twenty percent instead of seventy or  eighty. He made this city.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And that's what you were going to do  in the Valley?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (after a long moment) No, Mr. Gittes. That's what I am  doing with the Valley. The bond issue  passes Tuesday. There'll be ten  million to build an aqueduct and  reservoir. I'm doing it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There's going to be some irate  citizens when they find out they're  paying for water they're not getting.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's all taken care of. You see,  Mr. Gittes. Either you bring the  water to L.A. or you bring L.A. to  the water.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How do you do that?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just incorporate the Valley into the  city so the water goes to L.A. after  all. It's very simple.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gittes nods.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (then) How much are you worth?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (shrugs, then) I have no idea. How much do you want?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I want to know what you're worth.  Over ten million?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, my, yes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then why are you doing it? How much  better can you eat? What can you buy  that you can't already afford?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (a long moment, then:) The future, Mr. Gittes. The future.  Now where's the girl?... I want the  only daughter I have left... as you  found out, Evelyn was lost to me a  long time ago.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (with sarcasm) Who do you blame for that? Her?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cross makes a funny little cock of his head.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't blame myself. You see, Mr.  Gittes, most people never have to  face the fact that at the right time  and right place, they're capable of  anything. Take those glasses from  him, will you, Claude?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mulvihill moves INTO VIEW. Extends his hand for the glass Gittes doesn't move.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's not worth it, Mr. Gittes. It's  really not worth it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gittes hands over the glasses.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Take us to the girl. Either Evelyn  allows me to see her, or I'm not  averse to seeing Evelyn in jail. If  I have to buy the jail. Hollis and  Evelyn kept her from me for fifteen  years. It's been too long, I'm too  old.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The streets are crowded. Here and there one can see Chine in traditional dress.

dialogues.speaker: GITTES
dialogues.text: Driving slowly, spots Katherine with Ramon and luggage, n lost in the crowd. They are walking toward a car parked n a laundry truck. Gittes sees them, keeps driving.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (suddenly) Stop the car. Stop the car!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mulvihill tries to clobber Gittes. Gittes elbows him. The car jumps the curb and hits a lamppost.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Leaps out of the car shouting:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Katherine! Katherine! Wait!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gittes is after him, grabbing him. Cross tries to swing a Gittes with his cane. Mulvihill comes up behind Gittes an the three of them begin an awkward wrestling match, the c scattering, Mulvihill pulling his revolver, trying to hit Gittes on the side of the head. The three men crash to th pavement.

dialogues.speaker: CURLY
dialogues.text: Starts out of the car toward Gittes. Gittes sees him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, Curly, get 'em out of here! Get  'em out of here!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He bites Mulvihill's hand and furiously pounds it into th sidewalk, shaking gun loose. Mulvihill and Gittes try for but someone else has it.

dialogues.speaker: EVELYN
dialogues.text: Holds the gun. She's shaking but apparently in control of herself.

dialogues.speaker: GITTES
dialogues.text: Rises to his feet. Mulvihill starts to help Cross up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, don't help him. Don't do anything.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mulvihill doesn't move. Cross rises on his own. Evelyn ho the revolver on him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She's gone. It's no good.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (moving to Evelyn) Let me handle that.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Gittes) I'm all right.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (she's not) Sure, but I'd like to handle it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Evelyn backs up as her father takes a step toward her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're going to have to kill me,  Evelyn. Either that or tell me where  she is.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Evelyn is backing up. Cross moving on her. Evelyn cocks t pistol.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How many years have I got?... she's  mine too.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She's never going to know that.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There's the SOUND of a SIREN. Cross lunges toward her. Gi grabs Cross. Duffy and Walsh are elbowing through the crowd. Gittes se them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Duffy, go over and sit on Mulvihill. (to Walsh) Jesus Christ, I didn't tell you to  bring the police department with  you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jake, it's Chinatown. They're all  over the place. You oughta know  better.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Walsh, meaning  Cross) Gimme your keys. Watch this old fart,  will you? (moving to Evelyn) Take Duffy's car. Curly's boat's in  Pedro, near the Starkist cannery.  It's the Evening Star. He'll be  waiting. I'll take care of this.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She looks to Gittes. He looks at her. She turns and he lo at her. She turns and Escobar is standing between her and it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mrs. Mulwray, you don't want to run  around like that.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, Christ. Escobar, you don't know  what's going on. Let her go. I'll  explain it later.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mrs. Mulwray, it's a very serious  offense pointing that at an officer  of the law. It's a felony.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let her go. She didn't kill anybody.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (starting toward her) I'm sorry, Mrs. Mulwray.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lou, she will kill you. Let her go  for now. You don't know.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gittes, stay outta this.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Escobar continues to move toward her. Gittes grabs him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Evelyn) Now take off.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Evelyn gets in the car. She starts it. Gittes lets Escoba go.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll just have her followed. She's  not going anywhere.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There's a single GUNSHOT. Both men look surprised. Down t block a uniformed officer has fired, standing beside his  double-parked car. Duffy's sedan slows to a stop in the middle of the street It jerks a couple of times, still in gear, then comes to halt. Gittes rushes to the car. He opens it. Evelyn falls out,  inert. Blood is pouring from her right eye.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (yelling) No!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He holds onto Evelyn as Escobar and others hurry up. Cros himself elbows through.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where is he? I'll kill him, I'll  kill the son of a bitch.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Several officers contain Gittes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Escobar) Who is he, get his name? I'll kill  him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (badly shaken) Take it easy, take it easy, it was  an accident.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: An accident?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gittes looks down. What he sees horrifies him. Cross is o the ground, holding Evelyn's body, crying.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Get him away from her. He's  responsible for everything. Get him  away from her!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (stunned) Jake, you're very disturbed. You're  crazy. That's her father.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Walsh and Duffy elbow through the crowd.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to them) You wanna do your partner the biggest  favor of his life? Take him home.  Just get him the hell out of here!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Duffy bear hugs the protesting Gittes, along with Walsh,  literally dragging him away from the scene, with Gittes t to shake free. Through the crowd noises, Walsh can be heard saying, "For it, Jake. It's Chinatown."
